channel.title: Moparscape Classic lib_managed
channel.description:
How do I import this into my library in Eclipse? I've tried adding a lib_managed folder and putting the lib_managed jars in there, adding them to the main library, and then I tried adding a class folder under the options for the library. I don't understand.
edit: I know it has something to do with Ivy, I just can't figure out how to incorporate it into an Eclipse project

item.title: Moparscape Classic lib_managed
item.dc:creator: @CodeForFame CodeForFame
item.description:
@CodeForFame wrote:

[quote=“waj, post:6, topic:514056”][quote author=tigerclan link=topic=632304.msg4277173#msg4277173 date=1365084605]

right… well I did add the libraries, but they weren’t working. Also I really hate ant, I dunno why, but it really annoys me. But it seems to work if I set it up as a scala project since I installed the plugin. Only problem I have now is in JarUtil:

JarFile currentFile = new JarFile(jars.get(i).toString()

It says this code can’t be used before java 1.7… but the server is coded in 1.6??

actually nevermind. I guess it just wasn’t letting me initialize variables in a try statement… as in… try(initialize code here) { } so i just initialized currentFile in the brackets
[/quote]No, it requires Java 7…

oh. I thought moparclassic still had the xstream jdk7 problems

No, moparclassic is the only server which does support it, if I am correct.[/quote]You are correct.

Read full topic

It says this code can’t be used before java 1.7… but the server is coded in 1.6??

actually nevermind. I guess it just wasn’t letting me initialize variables in a try statement… as in… try(initialize code here) { } so i just initialized currentFile in the brackets
[/quote]No, it requires Java 7…

oh. I thought moparclassic still had the xstream jdk7 problems[/quote]
No, moparclassic is the only server which does support it, if I am correct.
